description: Add WebSocket-based real-time updates to the Orchestrator Dashboard to eliminate manual refresh. File watchers monitor all tracked projects (coderef/working/, coderef/archived/, coderef/stubs/) and broadcast events to connected clients via WebSocket.
goal: Enable real-time visibility of multi-agent work across projects, allowing the orchestrator dashboard to automatically update when agents create/modify plans, stubs, and workorders.
requirements: File watcher for all projects monitoring coderef/working/, coderef/archived/, coderef/stubs/ across all tracked projects
FastAPI WebSocket endpoint at /orchestrator/ws with connection management and heartbeat
Auto-reconnect logic with exponential backoff on disconnect
Event types: plan_added, plan_updated, plan_deleted, stub_added, stub_updated, stub_deleted, workorder_added
out_of_scope: Remove manual refresh button - keep as backup
constraints: Must work reliably on Windows with watchdog library
Electron backend runs on dynamic port - WebSocket must discover it via existing API
File watcher must not consume excessive CPU/memory with 7+ projects
Debouncing required for rapid file changes (e.g., git operations) to prevent event flooding
